clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Screening and Assessment of Shoulder, Neck and Lower Back Discomfort.
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Screening and Assessment of Shoulder, Neck and Lower Back Discomfort.

brief_summary.textblock: Identifying high-risk factors that may lead to shoulder, neck and lower back discomfort and contributing to the primary prevention of disease progression.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to design a self-assessment scheme for clinical assessment of shoulder, neck and lower back function and compare the consistency between clinical assessment and self-assessment. The body parameters (BMI, age, gender), daily activities (daily steps, sedentary), work and rest time (sleep time, quality) were collected through wearable devices, evaluating the risk factors of shoulder, neck and lower back discomfort.

primary_outcome.measure: Range of motion (ROM) of the neck
primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 2-week monitoring by wearable devices
primary_outcome.description: Patients' range of motion of the neck in all directions are measured using hand-held devices.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 2-week monitoring by wearable devices
primary_outcome.description: Oswestry Disability Index of the neck is collected for the evaluation of neck functions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 2-week monitoring by wearable devices
primary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scale is collected for pain assessment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 2-week monitoring by wearable devices
primary_outcome.description: Roland-Morris Disability Questionnaire is collected for the evaluation of lower back functions.
